intro: Phyllanthus virgatus var. oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It features small, ovate to elliptic leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
